title: How to Make a Watermelon Football Cake

steps.headline: Assemble the ingredients and items needed for completing the project.
steps.description: The items are listed below under "Things You Will Need".

steps.headline: Position the watermelon on a non-slip, flat surface.
steps.description: A silicon mat makes a good choice.

steps.headline: Slice 2 of the sides lengthwise down the watermelon to expose a large watermelon surface on both sides.
steps.description: Cut off and throw away the skin. It is often easier to do this by cutting the watermelon in half first.

steps.headline: Cut a football shape from the watermelon.
steps.description: Using a large knife, cut a marquise shape out of the watermelon flesh (this is a boat shape that is long and thin with sides that curve gently and end in a point at each end; just like a football). Discard the skin; it's no longer needed.

steps.headline: Place the football shaped watermelon pieces on a platter.
steps.description: If cut in half, assemble back together again to make a whole.

steps.headline: Slice the watermelon into thin slices all the way around the melon.
steps.description: Cut carefully, so as to leave it assembled as a football.

steps.headline: Decorate with the frosting and licorice ties to look like a football with stitches and to create the ends of the football (one line each end).

text: Assemble the ingredients and items needed for completing the project. The items are listed below under "Things You Will Need". Position the watermelon on a non-slip, flat surface. A silicon mat makes a good choice. Slice 2 of the sides lengthwise down the watermelon to expose a large watermelon surface on both sides. Cut off and throw away the skin. It is often easier to do this by cutting the watermelon in half first. Cut a football shape from the watermelon. Using a large knife, cut a marquise shape out of the watermelon flesh (this is a boat shape that is long and thin with sides that curve gently and end in a point at each end; just like a football). Discard the skin; it's no longer needed. Place the football shaped watermelon pieces on a platter. If cut in half, assemble back together again to make a whole. Slice the watermelon into thin slices all the way around the melon. Cut carefully, so as to leave it assembled as a football. Decorate with the frosting and licorice ties to look like a football with stitches and to create the ends of the football (one line each end).  Serve.
